descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: What constitutes "music"? When we listen to it, what are we really hearing, and what makes us feel what we feel? This course will explore the components of music and the ways that they work together to create meaning. While its primary focus will be the music of the Western classical tradition, the course will encompass a broad variety of genres and equip students with an enhanced capacity to understand and appreciate music of all kinds. Students will be expected to prepare readings and listening assignments for each class meeting and to discuss them using the vocabulary acquired throughout the course, as well as to complete written assignments, attend concerts, and prepare for quizzes and exams.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Course textbook: Robin Wallace, Take Note: An Introduction to Music through Active Listening (Oxford University Press). ISBN 9780195314335.
